title: By that criteria the shroud should be worth billions
post: Wiki has more detailed information, including a translation of the inscription. The artifact is purported to have been found in a Muslim cemetery near Temple Mount.  Interestingly, the antiquities dealer Oded Golan has been implicated in the Court proceedings brought by the IAA.  [Golan was likewise involved in the so-called “James ossuary” at Talpiot.]  The experts were unable to agree as to whether the Jehoash tablet was authentic or not.  The Wiki entry includes a header warning that some of the article’s content is disputed.  The IAA wants to confiscate the tablet, where qite likely it might quietly disappear. Golan says he wants it displayed in a museum for public view, but asserts neutrality on the question of authenticity.
author: daveb of wellington nz
